intro: Brassica sativa var. campestris, commonly known as Chinese cabbage, is a biennial plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy stalks and tightly wrapped leaves that form a compact head. The plant is native to East Asia and is widely cultivated for its edible leaves and stems. It prefers cool climates and well-drained soil, often growing to a height of 30–60 cm. This variety is valued for its nutritional content and is commonly used in various Asian cuisines.
